---
title: STIFF SENTENCES
author: ''
date: '2022-08-29'
slug: stiff_sentences
categories: []
tags: []
r_init: |-
  
description: The Government of Canada spent an estimated $506.8K
  in 2021-2022 on contracts with STIFF SENTENCES. The average
  contract duration was 0.9 year, and the average contract
  value (not including contracts under $10k) was $263.4K.
  The longest contract was 4.88 year. The largest contract
  by value (including amendments) was $7.9M.
most_recent_fiscal_year_total: '506.8K'
most_recent_fiscal_year_year: '2021-2022'
s431_number_of_contracts_by_vendor: '36'
s431_number_of_contracts_by_vendor_with_amendments: '5'
s431_number_of_contracts_amendments_percentage: '14%'
s432_mean_amendment_increase_percentage_by_vendor: '56%'
s434_mean_number_of_amendments_by_vendor: '1.4'
s433_total_amendment_increase_value_by_vendor: '3.4M'
s424_mean_duration_by_vendor: '0.9'
s421_mean_contract_value_by_vendor: '263.4K'
s425_max_duration_by_vendor: '4.88'
s422_max_contract_value_by_vendor: '7.9M'
---
